body.p: The former Preface to Statements of International Accounting Standards stated that International Accounting Standards were not intended to apply to immaterial items. There is no equivalent statement in the Preface to International Financial Reporting Standards. The Board received comments that the absence of such a statement from the Preface could be interpreted as requiring an entity to apply accounting policies (including measurement requirements) specified by IFRSs to immaterial items. However, the Board decided that the application of the concept of materiality should be in Standards rather than in the Preface.
